category.term: 1223~Jersey Shore (TV Show)~Nicole "Snooki" Polizzi~Us Weekly~MTV Networks Company
category.label: InformQString

content.div:
Go to any nightclub in the world, and you'll find prospective cast members for Jersey Shore. Those bros and ho's need places to crash (and smoosh)! Ones outfitted with zebra-print couches and duck phones, if at all possible! And yet, if Jersey Shore is getting any new stars in time for a prospective Season 6, the latest addition will have been spawned for the job.

Snooki is pregnant, everybody. At least, that's what the New York Post is claiming, reporting her wee, little meatball is just three months along -- and reportedly fathered by the 24-year-old's boyfriend and sometime Jersey Shore co-star Jionni LaValle.

E! News is also backing with story, with columnist Marc Malkin quoting a source who tells him, "She's about three to four months along."

Snooki has denied pregnancy rumours in the past -- notably just this month, when she went on Good Morning America to brush off a story published in Star. "I definitely do want kids, but I'm not pregnant," she told GMA's Lara Spencer Feb. 2. "Being pregnant should be a real thing and a happy thing," she continued.

And, as per the Post's suggestion, it should also be something that scores a modest pay-out from a celeb glossy. Making a pregancy announcement isn't something to treat carelessly, though. It isn't as easy as getting arrested for a drunk-and-disorderly. Or, say, getting pregnant. But the Post reports Snooki sold her baby news to Us Weekly after shopping the story to various mags, and she's looking to rebrand herself as a celebrity mommy -- "the next Kourtney Kardashian," as per the Post's source.

Behind the scenes, though, MTV is supposedly scrambling to figure out a strategy. Snooki and her Jersey Shore castmate JWowww have already begun filming their spin-off show, and while we assume producers expected Snooks to provide a few scenes involving weird pickle cravings, a pregnancy wasn't part of the plan. "MTV went into crisis mode after they found out," one snoop told the Post. "They're trying to hide it because it would greatly affect the creative direction of the show."

About that: Snooki and JWoww spoke to Us Weekly yesterday about the spinoff, and compared to Jersey Shore it sounds snoozy enough to bring Mini-Snooks to term without fear of alarming child services.

"We want it to be different than Jersey Shore, so it's not always going to be at the club, drinking and partying," JWoww told Us Weekly. "You guys know we can drink, you know we can party."

"You've only seen the party side of us," Snooki interjected. "You haven't seen this side of us, which is -- sober. And normal."

Snooki continued: "Me and Jenni are in serious relationships, so obviously we're not going to be wanting to go to the Shore all the time, we want to settle down."

When asked about the pregnancy report by People, Snooki's rep responded, "No comment."

leahc@dose.ca

entry.title: Jersey Shore Top 10 Unforgettable Pop Culture Moments

link.Abstract: As the show enters its fifth season, we take a look at ten of the most unforgettable pop culture moments featuring the cast of Jersey Shore.
link.title: [ more ]

link.Abstract: It was not long ago that a young group of orange-faced guidos and guidettes blind sighted the world with their oddly entrancing Gym, Tan, Laundry lifestyle and odd disfiguring of the English language. Since that fateful day in 2009, the phenomenon that is The Jersey Shore has stretched far beyond the beaches of the Garden State, launching its stars into the mainstream consciousness and beyond. As the show enters its fifth season, we take a look at ten of the most unforgettable pop culture moments featuring the cast of Jersey Shore.
link.title: Jersey Shore Gallery 1
